content.description:
Sit start in center of boulder with left hand in obvious pocket and right hand fist jamming a left-leaning rail.  Crank hard on your fist and move up to solid iron rings.  To finish, climb to highest point of boulder.  

  -Alternate start is to the right on a red colored jug, left hand sidepulling the crack. Goes at V1-ish??
content.location: Sit start in the center of Adventure Time boulder at the base of a left trending seam/shallow crack.

content.description: Sit start with poor feet and use compressive holds to move up and along the arete gaining better feet after a few moves.  This problem finishes where the problem Jake does.
content.location: On the left side of Adventure Time Boulder which is located on the right, past the Labyrinth and adjacent to an old logging road.  Look for a ~9 foot tall very triangular boulder.

content.description:
This one is pretty fun for a short little one-move wonder.

 Find the extremely low pocket at the base of the boulder. This is your right heel-hook hole. 3 inches bove and left of the pocket is a slopey edge/lip for your right hand, and to the far left (the boulder rises up out of the ground) you pinch the fin/bottom lip of the boulder for the start.

 Toss up and right to latch a thin crimp, lock off, and pounce up to the top arÃªte (where Finn starts). Finish to the top of the boulder.

 (I suppose this is sort of a sit-start to Finn?)
This is a tiny little block that is easy to overlook. A few easy, fun, and quality little problems, and a one-move wonder.
